title: Sky Inks Multi-Year Disney+ Distribution Deal, Offers Streaming Bundle With Netflix, HBO Max and Hayu
description: Sky and Disney have inked a multi-year distribution deal that will see the broadcaster offer Disney+ to Sky customers in the U.K. and Ireland at no
body:
Sky and Disney have inked a multi-year distribution deal that will see the broadcaster offer Disney+ to Sky customers in the U.K. and Ireland at no extra cost as well as offering a streaming bundle including HBO Max, Netflix and Hayu.

	The deal will also see Sky, a Comcast subsidiary, debut a dedicated Disney+ Cinema linear channel.

	Launching March 2026, Disney+ (standard with ads tier) will be included in a variety of Sky TV subscriptions as well as further integration of the app with Skyâ€™s operating system, saving Sky customers Â£5.99 per month. As part of the deal Disney+ shows will be promoted alongside Sky content on the â€œcontinue watchingâ€ rail and in recommendations.
	

	Sky subscribers can activate Disney+ through products such as Sky Q, Sky Glass and Sky Stream while Disney+ customers who move their accounts and profiles over to watch via Sky can also make the cost saving.


	As part of the offering, Sky will offer a bundle featuring Disney+, HBO Max, Netflix and Hayu into a single Sky TV subscription, starting at Â£24 a month for a two-year fixed-term contract.

	â€œWeâ€™re really delighted with this deal, because customers tell us they face so much choice and complexity in this market so by signing this agreement, weâ€™ve agreed to a much deeper level of product integration,â€ Sophia Ahmad, chief consumer officer at Sky, told Variety.

	Karl Holmes, Disney+ general manager in EMEA, told Variety: â€œThere are millions of customers at Sky who have currently chosen not to buy Disney+ direct, and they will now get Disney+ at no extra cost. And we would expect that those customers will use the Disney+ app and will enjoy our content.â€
	

	To date the U.K. has been the largest European market for Disney+ and is primarily direct to consumer, although the Mouse House does have deals with Virgin Media, Uber, Lloyds Bank and Tesco in the territory in relation to its streaming platform. Holmes clarified that none of those deals â€œare of the size or ambition of this arrangement with Sky.â€

	He added that the aim of the deal was to reach â€œmillions of customers who prefer to buy TV as part of a larger subscription, and in that sense, it is complementary and additive to our existing growth.â€ Holmes predicted the agreement would take Disney+â€™s reach in the U.K. and Ireland up by around 40%, accounting for overlap, with the numbers based on BARBâ€™s establishment survey.

	Both parties declined to comment on the term of the agreement, although Holmes said it was â€œmultiple years,â€ adding: â€œWe wouldnâ€™t do this for a short amount of time.â€

	The deal not extend to co-productions or the distribution of Disney+ content outside of the streaming platform and linear Disney+ Cinema channel.

schema.headline: Sky Inks Multi-Year Disney+ Distribution Deal, Offers Streaming Bundle With Netflix, HBO Max and Hayu

title: Singapore Film Festival Shifts to October, Promotes Jeremy Chua to Executive Director
description: The Singapore International Film Festival will move its 37th edition to an earlier calendar slot, running from Oct. 21 to Nov. 1, 2026, while elevat
body:
The Singapore International Film Festival will move its 37th edition to an earlier calendar slot, running from Oct. 21 to Nov. 1, 2026, while elevating Jeremy Chua to the role of executive director.

	The festival, which has traditionally taken place between late November and early December, is repositioning itself to avoid direct competition with year-end Hollywood tentpoles. The 36th edition ran Nov. 26 to Dec. 7, 2025.


	â€œThe shift to October positions SGIFF within an optimal window for theatrical releases of independent film in Singapore, allowing films to reach local audiences without competing directly with the year-end slate of major Hollywood blockbusters,â€ according to the festival. â€œThis strategic move reaffirms SGIFFâ€™s commitment to enhance visibility for independent world cinema, while supporting distributors and filmmakers in boosting audience engagement.â€
	

	The 2025 edition saw ticket sales rise 33% from 2024, and a 28.7% increase in audiences. 

	â€œThe decision to reposition the festival reflects our intention to place greater emphasis on the distribution and exhibition needs of independent and auteur cinema,â€ said Chua. â€œBy collaborating more closely with distributors during a more suitable release period, we aim to strengthen reach and engagement beyond the festival itself.â€

	The new dates could place SGIFF in direct overlap with the Tokyo International Film Festival, which is expected to run Oct. 25 to Nov. 5. SGIFF will also run simultaneously with the Ji.hlava International Documentary Film Festival in the Czech Republic (Oct. 23 to Nov. 1).
	

	The positioning creates a potential Asian festival circuit flow, with SGIFF launching just six days after the Busan International Film Festival concludes on Oct. 15. Industry professionals and filmmakers could attend Busan before continuing to Singapore and Tokyo in rapid succession. However, the compressed timeline may challenge films seeking multiple Asian festival premieres, with programmers at both Singapore and Tokyo competing for the same titles.

	The date change also takes SGIFF of the annual Singapore Media Festival celebrations, which also encompasses Singapore Comic Con and the Nas Summit. 

	Chua, previously the festivalâ€™s general manager, brings producing credits including â€œFilipinanaâ€ by Rafael Manuel, which won a Special Jury Prize in Sundanceâ€™s World Dramatic Competition earlier this year. His other credits include â€œSome Rain Must Fallâ€ by Qiu Yang, which earned a Special Jury Prize at Berlinale Encounters 2024, and â€œInside the Yellow Cocoon Shellâ€ by Pham Thien An, winner of the Cannes Camera dâ€™Or in 2023.

	SGIFF chair Boo Junfeng praised Chuaâ€™s industry knowledge and filmmaker perspective in the appointment announcement. â€œAs a producer whose films have competed in and won our Silver Screen Awards, Jeremy brings a filmmakerâ€™s perspective and a strong commitment to championing independent filmmakers while caring deeply about how their films can engage wider audiences,â€ Boo said.

	The festival also announced that its Film Fund, which supports Southeast Asian documentary and short film production, will take a temporary hiatus for strategic restructuring. Established in 2018, the fund has distributed S$885,000 (approximately $700,000) to nearly 50 regional films through its SEA-Doc Grant and SEA-Shorts Grant programs.

	Recipients have included documentaries â€œAswangâ€ by Alyx Ayn Arumpac (Philippines, 2019) and â€œMonismeâ€ by Riar Rizaldi (Indonesia, 2023), along with shorts â€œMulberry Fieldsâ€ by Nguyá»…n Trung NghÄ©a (Vietnam, 2024) and â€œBleat!â€ by Ananth Subramaniam (Malaysia, 2025).

	â€œThis short hiatus gives us the necessary space to work closely with our partners to strengthen the SGIFF Film Fund for the long term,â€ Chua said. â€œOur commitment to filmmakers and the regional industry remains unchanged, and we look forward to relaunching the Fund later this year with a renewed framework that responds meaningfully to todayâ€™s production and distribution realities.â€
	

	The festival receives support from the Infocomm Media Development Authority. Additional programming details and the return of the film fund will be announced at a later date.

	Submissions for Asian feature films and Southeast Asian short films will open April 9, 2026.

schema.headline: Singapore Film Festival Shifts to October, Promotes Jeremy Chua to Executive Director

title: Richard Kind Returning to â€˜The Producersâ€™ on Londonâ€™s West End
description:
Richard Kind is returning to â€œThe Producers,â€ this time in London.

	The Drama Desk Award winner is set to reprise the role of Max Bialystock in the
body:
Richard Kind is returning to â€œThe Producers,â€ this time in London.

	The Drama Desk Award winner is set to reprise the role of Max Bialystock in the critically acclaimed West End revival for seven weeks only, from March 23 to May 11. Heâ€™ll star opposite Marc Antolinâ€™s Leo Bloom at the Garrick Theatre while Andy Nyman, who is currently playing Max, departs for the world premiere of â€œThe Psychic.â€


	Kind previously played the role of Max on Broadway in 2004, succeeding Nathan Lane, and again in 2012 for a production at the Hollywood Bowl in Los Angeles. The Mel Brooks musical, which won 12 Tony Awards after opening in 2001, follows two theater producers who try to get rich by overselling interests in a Broadway musical designed to fail.
	

	â€œMel Brooks is a genius,â€ Kind said in a statement. â€œEvery time I come back to â€˜The Producers,â€™ Iâ€™m reminded what a comic masterpiece it is â€” the jokes, the infectious energy of the story, the sheer audacity of it all â€” it still feels as fresh as ever. Iâ€™m so thrilled to be returning to the iconic role of Max Bialystock; this is a hat trick for me â€š they just canâ€™t keep me away! Iâ€™ll be sure to keep Andyâ€™s fedora warm for his return, and Iâ€™m excited to dive into rehearsals. Itâ€™s good to be back.â€


	Added Brooks, â€œWhen I learned we needed an actor to briefly fill Andyâ€™s nearly unfillable shoes, only one name came to mind. Richard Kind is a true force of nature â€” heâ€™s got enough talent and energy to fill two stages! I am beyond thrilled for audiences at The Garrick to experience his Max Bialystock. London, get ready; youâ€™re in for a hilarious ride!â€

schema.headline: Richard Kind Returning to â€˜The Producersâ€™ on Londonâ€™s West End

title: Southeast Asia Streaming Surges With 19% Growth, Indonesian Content Rivals K-Dramas, Report Finds
description: The premium streaming market in Southeast Asia gained significant momentum in 2025, powered by a resurgence in account growth, expanded connected TV
body:
The premium streaming market in Southeast Asia gained significant momentum in 2025, powered by a resurgence in account growth, expanded connected TV adoption and a landmark year for locally produced programming, new data from Media Partners Asia and its measurement platform AMPD shows.

	Paid streaming accounts across the region increased 19% year-over-year to exceed 61 million across Indonesia, Thailand, the Philippines, Malaysia and Singapore in 2025. Indonesia dominated new account additions and consumed the largest portion of total watch time, while Thailand and the Philippines contributed consistent incremental expansion. In Malaysia and Singapore, where markets have reached saturation, operators focused on boosting user activity and revenue generation rather than adding subscribers.
	

	Southeast Asian viewers consumed 4.2 billion hours of premium streaming content in the final quarter of 2025, up 8% from the previous quarter. Netflixâ€˜s regional viewing jumped 14% while iQIYI climbed 10%, though Indonesian service Vidio posted the sharpest increase at 24%.


	Indonesiaâ€™s streaming subscriber base expanded to 26.9 million accounts, with Netflix, Vidio, Viu and iQIYI all contributing to the gains. The market reached a historic milestone in Q4 2025 as Indonesian productions equaled Korean programming in viewership share at 30% each, while both content types reached nearly identical portions of the user base at 47-48%. Several Indonesian originals placed among the quarterâ€™s top-performing titles, led predominantly by Vidioâ€™s content lineup, demonstrating how homegrown productions are becoming commercially viable drivers of subscriber acquisition and retention.
	

	â€œKorean content continued to anchor reach across Southeast Asia in 2025, but local originals are now playing a far more central role in driving both acquisition and engagement,â€ said Dhivya T, lead analyst and head of insights at MPA and AMPD. â€œIndonesia stood out this year, with local titles competing directly with Korean dramas at the top of the premium VOD rankings. This is a meaningful shift that reflects improving content quality, stronger distribution and rising audience confidence in local storytelling. Thai content also demonstrated strong cross-border travelability, while Chinese dramas remained a key engagement driver on freemium and hybrid platforms across multiple markets.â€

	Netflix held its position as the regionâ€™s dominant streaming service across all key metrics including subscriber count, monthly active users and total watch time. The platformâ€™s strength came from its combination of global hit franchises, major Korean series and locally acquired content from Indonesia and Thailand. Viu claimed the second spot regionally in subscribers, MAUs and user engagement for 2025, benefiting from consistent appetite for Korean and Chinese dramas alongside targeted local productions.

	Vidio led among Indonesian local platforms in both subscribers and monthly active users while placing second to Netflix in watch time and revenue generation. The service recorded the regionâ€™s second-highest streaming hours in Q4 trailing only Netflix, propelled by an expanding library of Indonesian originals and sports programming. iQIYI regained subscriber and viewership momentum in the latter half of 2025, especially in Indonesia and Thailand, driven by full-length Chinese dramas, live-action productions, Chinese short-form dramas and Thai series.

	Thai productions achieved the strongest international reach within Southeast Asia, drawing 11.1 million viewers from outside Thailandâ€™s borders. This performance stemmed largely from Netflix-licensed and Netflix-produced horror films and series.

	AMPDâ€™s expansion of connected TV tracking beginning in Q2 2025 uncovered a substantial shift in how Southeast Asian audiences consume streaming content. Although mobile devices continue to serve as the dominant viewing platform, connected TVs now account for an increasing portion of total watch hours, longer individual viewing sessions, and greater interaction with episodic series, feature films, sports broadcasts and content watched by multiple household members. The growth in connected TV usage proved most dramatic in Indonesia and the Philippines, highlighting how living room viewing on large screens is becoming central to the streaming categoryâ€™s evolution.
	

	Industry concentration intensified as three to four platforms captured roughly 70% of subscriptions and viewing activity across markets, indicating the sector is consolidating around a small group of leading services.

schema.headline: Southeast Asia Streaming Surges With 19% Growth, Indonesian Content Rivals K-Dramas, Report Finds

title: Hong Sangsooâ€™s Berlinale Selection, New Animation Expand Finecutâ€™s EFM Slate
description: Korean sales powerhouse Finecut has bolstered its European Film Market offerings with two new acquisitions: the 3D animated feature â€œLong Long Night
body:
Korean sales powerhouse Finecut has bolstered its European Film Market offerings with two new acquisitions: the 3D animated feature â€œLong Long Nightâ€ and auteur Hong Sangsooâ€˜s latest work â€œThe Day She Returns,â€ which has been selected for the Panorama section at the 76th Berlin Film Festival.

	â€œLong Long Nightâ€ adapts an award-winning Korean novel that has sold 700,000 copies locally. The source material earned the Grand Prize at the 2020 Munhakdongne Childrenâ€™s Literature Award and was featured on the International Youth Libraryâ€™s 2021 White Ravens list in Munich. International editions have been released in Japan, Taiwan, Thailand and TÃ¼rkiye, with a Chinese version forthcoming. The property has also been adapted into a stage musical.
	

	The animated feature tells the story of the last rhino of his kind who befriends a penguin hatched from an abandoned egg, embarking on a journey to the ocean together. The narrative draws inspiration from Sudan, the last surviving northern white rhino on Earth. Director Youm Kyu-bock is utilizing Unreal Engine, a real-time 3D creation platform, to achieve realistic detailed imagery. Currently in production, the film is produced by Googgoog and Studio Eon, with presentation by The Contents On.


	â€œThe Day She Returnsâ€ is Hong Sangsooâ€™s 34th feature film and marks his seventh year at the Berlinale, following his most recent title â€œWhat Does That Nature Say to Youâ€ (2025). The film follows an actor giving promotional interviews to support her comeback film, a process that proves more difficult than anticipated. The project reunites Hong with actress Song Sunmi, who previously starred in his â€œIn Our Dayâ€ (2023), which closed the Cannes Directorsâ€™ Fortnight. Following its world premiere at the Berlinale, the film is scheduled for theatrical release in the first half of 2026. Jeonwonsa Film Co. serves as producer.
	

	Finecutâ€™s EFM slate also includes â€œTristes Tropiques,â€ an action-noir from genre director Park Hoon-jung currently in post-production. The filmâ€™s initial cut premiered in the Ã’rbita Competition section at Sitges.

	Additional titles include â€œJourney There,â€ starring Justin H. Min of Netflixâ€™s â€œThe Umbrella Academy,â€ which won two awards at the Busan International Film Festival. The drama follows an elderly woman who finds comfort with strangers while navigating end-of-life decisions.

	The lineup is rounded out by â€œWrangler,â€ a psychological thriller about a dog trainer whose controlled life begins to unravel, which was invited to Vancouver, and â€œTime of Cinema,â€ an anthology featuring works from three Korean directors: Lee Jong-pil, Yoon Ga-eun and Jang Kun-jae.

schema.headline: Hong Sangsooâ€™s Berlinale Selection, New Animation Expand Finecutâ€™s EFM Slate

title: Anil Kapoor Action-Drama â€˜Subedaarâ€™ Sets Prime Video Bow, Unveils Teaser (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Prime Video has set a global premiere for â€œSubedaar,â€ an action-drama starring Anil Kapoor (â€œSlumdog Millionaireâ€) and Radhikka Madan (â€œThe Man Who
body:
Prime Video has set a global premiere for â€œSubedaar,â€ an action-drama starring Anil Kapoor (â€œSlumdog Millionaireâ€) and Radhikka Madan (â€œThe Man Who Feels No Painâ€). A teaser has been unveiled. 

	Directed by Suresh Triveni, known for his work on â€œTumhari Sulu,â€ â€œJalsaâ€ and â€œDaldal,â€ the project is produced by Vikram Malhotra, Kapoor and Triveni through Opening Image Films in association with Anil Kapoor Film & Communication Network.
	

	The film centers on Subedaar Arjun Maurya, a retired soldier navigating a world where his traditional values face modern challenges. Kapoorâ€™s character confronts crime and corruption while dealing with strained family relationships. Set in Indiaâ€™s heartland, the film is a positioned as a cinematic, gritty and intense exploration of honor in the midst of societal decay.


	Triveni and Prajwal Chandrashekar penned the screenplay. The supporting cast includes Saurabh Shukla, Aditya Rawal, Faisal Malik and Mona Singh in key roles.

	â€œâ€˜Subedaarâ€™ is both a high-octane action movie as well as a deeply moving father-daughter story. It features a tremendous performance from Anil Kapoor playing an action hero that will make people root for him right from the outset,â€ said Nikhil Madhok, director and head of Originals at Prime Video India. â€œWe are proud to collaborate with Suresh Triveni, Anil Kapoor, Vikram Malhotra, and the entire team on â€˜Subedaarâ€™ and look forward to bringing it to audiences in India and across the world.â€

	Vikram Malhotra, partner at Opening Image Films and producer of the project, described the film as featuring â€œa never-seen-before lead character who is shaped by service, discipline, and sacrifice.â€ He added that the collaboration brought together the right creative voices to authentically build the world of the story.
	

	â€œWith superstar and powerhouse actor Anil Kapoor at the centre, the film offers audiences a compelling cinematic experience like never-before exclusively on Prime Video,â€ Malhotra said.

	The film will be available in the Hindi, Tamil and Telugu languages. â€œSubedaarâ€ premieres on Prime Video on March 5.

	Watch the teaser here:

schema.headline: Anil Kapoor Action-Drama â€˜Subedaarâ€™ Sets Prime Video Bow, Unveils Teaser (EXCLUSIVE)

title: â€˜Severance,â€™ â€˜Bon AppÃ©tit, Your Majestyâ€™ Among Winners at CJ ENM Visionary Awards
description: Korean entertainment giant CJ ENM celebrated the creative forces behind six globally successful original IPs at its 2026 Visionary Awards ceremony o
body:
Korean entertainment giant CJ ENM celebrated the creative forces behind six globally successful original IPs at its 2026 Visionary Awards ceremony on Feb. 10 at the CJ ENM Center in Seoulâ€™s Mapo-gu district.

	The event honored visionaries from U.S. series â€œSeveranceâ€ and Korean productions â€œBon AppÃ©tit, Your Majesty,â€ â€œBoys II Planet,â€ â€œOur Unwritten Seoulâ€ and â€œStudy Group,â€ along with the Japanese adaptation of â€œMarry My Husbandâ€ â€“ marking CJ ENMâ€™s continued expansion into international co-productions and overseas projects. The ceremony drew particular attention for bringing together creators from both Korean productions and global collaborations, including â€œSeveranceâ€ producer Nicholas Weinstock and Japanese actor Takeru Satoh from â€œMarry My Husband.â€
	

	Since 2020, CJ ENM has designated as â€œVisionariesâ€ the creators and projects that have introduced fresh creative visions to the entertainment industry and expanded their cultural footprint globally through distinctive originality. This yearâ€™s selections focused on characters as a core driver of IP competitiveness, recognizing the actors who portrayed beloved characters alongside the directors, producers and writers who brought them to life.


	The awards venue was designed around the theme of an â€œOriginality Construction Site,â€ conceived as a space for building a House of Inspiration â€“ symbolizing a place where one story does not end but a new one begins.

	Weinstock praised the ceremonyâ€™s focus on creative ambition over commercial metrics. â€œIâ€™m very excited about the commitment that many of us in this room are making to telling great and bold stories,â€ he said. â€œI think thereâ€™s a reason CJ ENM is giving the Visionary Award rather than a quarterly revenues award. I believe itâ€™s a company devoted to boldness and creativity.â€ The producer also expressed admiration for presenter Youn Yuh-jung, a 2021 Visionary and the first Korean actor to receive an Academy Award. â€œI watched â€˜Minariâ€™ three times in a row just to see her performance,â€ Weinstock said.
	

	Takeru Satoh reflected on character development. â€œAs actors, we are constantly thinking about how to make the roles we play more compelling and more loved by the audiences,â€ he said. â€œItâ€™s a great honor to be here with all of you professionals who create these unforgettable characters.â€

	Park Min Young from â€œMarry My Husbandâ€ described the project as transformative. â€œThis project was like a second chance in my life. While it tells a Korean story, I learned that sincerity resonates with audiences worldwide,â€ she said.

	From â€œBon AppÃ©tit, Your Majesty,â€ Lim YoonA shared her connection to her character. â€œIt was a great joy to portray Yeon Ji-young, a strong and wise character who never loses her dream, no matter the circumstances,â€ she said.

	In a congratulatory video message, CJ Group vice chair Miky Lee emphasized the power of storytelling. â€œTechnology has brought the world closer than ever, but it is stories that truly bring people together,â€ she said. â€œCJ ENM will be your partner in this journey.â€

	CJ ENM CEO Yoon Sang-hyun added: â€œThe most compelling stories begin with characters shaped together by creators and artists. We will expand Onlyone IPs, stories that become life-defining works for audiences worldwide and build a new ecosystem for the global cultural business.â€

schema.headline: â€˜Severance,â€™ â€˜Bon AppÃ©tit, Your Majestyâ€™ Among Winners at CJ ENM Visionary Awards

title: â€˜Lunchbox,â€™ â€˜Mantoâ€™ Producers Back Anshuman Jha, Devashish Makhija EFM Thriller â€˜But First, The Burningâ€™ (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Roh Films Germany is returning to India for its first local production since â€œThe Lunchboxâ€ (2013), partnering with First Ray Films India on noir th
body:
Roh Films Germany is returning to India for its first local production since â€œThe Lunchboxâ€ (2013), partnering with First Ray Films India on noir thriller â€œBut First, The Burning.â€

	The film will be directed by Indian filmmaker Devashish Makhija and star Anshuman Jha. Franceâ€™s En Compagnie des Lamas (â€œMantoâ€), led by Sandrine Brauer, is confirmed to join as French producer. Details will be finalised at the Berlin European Film Market. 
	

	â€œBut First, The Burningâ€ follows two brothers sharing one identity in a desperate town, where a small deceit meant to double their chances at survival spirals into a deadly game of secrets with only one survivor.


	Makhijaâ€™s internationally recognized filmography includes â€œJoram,â€ â€œBhonsleâ€ and â€œAjji.â€ His Netflix thriller â€œGandhariâ€ is due this year. Jha has built a diverse career across projects including â€œLove Sex Aur Dhokha,â€ â€œChaurangaâ€ and â€œLakadbaggha.â€ 

	The film is scheduled to begin production in October, following the release of Jhaâ€™s action sequel â€œLakadbaggha 2.â€ Jha will represent the film in Berlin as leading actor and executive producer.

	â€œIntegrity. Conviction. And unadulterated vision â€“ is the basis of this partnership,â€ Jha said. â€œWe are thrilled to have Roh and Lamas on board for this film which would mark our seventh production. And probably the most ambitious one with one of my favorite cinema makers in India â€“ Devashish.â€

	Benny Drechsel of Roh Films Germany said: â€œI really think that â€˜But First, The Burningâ€™ is probably the most compelling script from India since â€˜The Lunchbox.'â€

	Sandrine Brauer of Lamas added: â€œIâ€™m very proud to join forces with the creative duo formed by Anshuman and Devashish. Their film casts a lucid, uncompromising, yet deeply necessary light on the spiral of violence. Devashishâ€™s previous films already reveal a distinctive and promising voice, with a rare ability to take us on powerful and compelling cinematic journeys.â€

schema.headline: â€˜Lunchbox,â€™ â€˜Mantoâ€™ Producers Back Anshuman Jha, Devashish Makhija EFM Thriller â€˜But First, The Burningâ€™ (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Person Detained for Questioning in Connection With Nancy Guthrieâ€™s Disappearance Is Released
description: UPDATED: The Pima County Sheriffâ€™s Department announced on X Tuesday night that it, in collaboration with the FBI, had detained a person for questio
body:
UPDATED: The Pima County Sheriffâ€™s Department announced on X Tuesday night that it, in collaboration with the FBI, had detained a person for questioning in connection with the disappearance of â€œTodayâ€ host Savannah Guthrieâ€˜s 84-year-old mother, Nancy Guthrie. A man was then released several hours later, according to CBS News, the New York Times and others.

	The man, identified only as Carlos, spoke to reporters after his release and said he doesnâ€™t know who Nancy Guthrie is and was shocked to be detained. â€œI didnâ€™t do anything. â€¦ Iâ€™m innocent,â€ he said.
	

	Authorities have not confirmed that he was the person of interest or that the subject detained has been released, however a spokesperson for the Sheriffâ€™s Department confirmed to the New York Times had â€œcompleted their search of a property in Rio Rico,â€ where the person was detained.


	The Pima County Sheriffâ€™s Department said the person was detained south of Tucson, Ariz. during a traffic stop. Authorities told ABC that law enforcement is preparing to search a location in relation to the detainee. There was no indication whether the detainee was the individual in the front door photos released on Tuesday morning.

	Nancy Guthrie, 84, disappeared from her Arizona home on Jan. 31, triggering an intensive investigation that has brought â€œTodayâ€ show co-anchor Savannah Guthrieâ€™s personal tragedy into the public eye.

	The Pima County Sheriffâ€™s Office declared the disappearance a crime on Feb. 2 after investigators discovered â€œconcerningâ€ evidence at Nancyâ€™s home. Sheriff Chris Nanos said he believed Nancy â€œdid not leave on her own.â€ Authorities have not identified any suspects, and they received an alleged ransom note with deadlines set for Friday, Feb. 6, and Monday, Feb. 9.
	

	Savannah shared a message Monday on Instagram as the search for her missing mother entered its second week. â€œWeâ€™re at an hour of desperation,â€ she said in the video message.

	Former co-anchor Hoda Kotb also returned to the â€œTodayâ€ show on Monday, filling in alongside Craig Melvin while Savannah remained with her family in Arizona. â€œWe are a family, and we show up for each other,â€ Kotb said during the broadcast.

	The FBI offered a $50,000 reward Thursday for information leading to Nancyâ€™s recovery â€œand/or the arrest and conviction of anyone involved in her disappearance.â€ FBI Special Agent in Charge Heith Janke said agents are â€œworking day and nightâ€ with local authorities.

	On Saturday, the Guthrie siblings posted another video expressing their willingness to pay a ransom. â€œWe received your message, and we understand,â€ Savannah said, sitting beside by siblings Camron and Annie. â€œWe beg you now to return our mother to us so that we can celebrate with her. This is very valuable to us, and we will pay.â€

	This followed an emotional video shared to Instagram on Wednesday in which the siblings pleaded for proof of life. â€œSheâ€™s 84 years old. Her health, her heart, is fragile,â€ Savannah said. â€œWe need to know without a doubt that she is alive and that you have her.â€

schema.headline: Person Detained for Questioning in Connection With Nancy Guthrieâ€™s Disappearance Is Released

title: Brian Tse, Alireza Ghasemi, Tayfun Pirselimoglu Projects Among Hong Kong HAFâ€™s Final Slate
description: The Hong Kong International Film Festival Society has finalized the program for the 24th Hong Kong-Asia Film Financing Forum (HAF), adding 13 projec
body:
The Hong Kong International Film Festival Society has finalized the program for the 24th Hong Kong-Asia Film Financing Forum (HAF), adding 13 projects featuring McDull creator Brian Tse, Sundance winner Alireza Ghasemi and Turkish director Tayfun Pirselimoglu to complete a 42-title lineup set for presentation March 17-19 at the Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre.

	The final batch comprises seven animated features and six genre works at various development and production stages, joining 29 previously announced in-development and work-in-progress projects. All titles will be showcased at the HKIFF Industry Project Market alongside FilMart, now in its 30th edition.
	

	Three of the newly announced projects are in production or post-production: Brian Tseâ€™s â€œThe Excreman â€“ On the Road,â€ Avid Liongorenâ€™s â€œZsazsa Zaturnnahâ€ and Qin Yuqiâ€™s suspense thriller â€œWhat My Bones Know.â€ The trio will pitch at the WIP Open Pitch session on March 17 alongside the previously announced 12 work-in-progress titles.


	HAFâ€™s dedicated animation section, launched last year, has quickly established a track record for festival success. Xu Zaoâ€™s â€œLight Pillarâ€ is set to premiere at Berlinaleâ€™s Perspectives section this month, while Toe Yuenâ€™s â€œA Mighty Adventureâ€ won the Golden Horse Award for best sound effects last November. Both projects emerged from the sectionâ€™s inaugural edition.

	The animation slate features Tse, creator of the McDull franchise, directing â€œThe Excreman â€“ On the Road,â€ about a massive piece of excrement that defeats a plumber dispatched to cleanse a sewer community, then assumes the plumberâ€™s identity to begin a new human life.
	

	Jhun Yong Duk, co-director of â€œThe Tigerâ€™s Apprentice,â€ helms â€œFish Ball,â€ following a ruthless general reborn as a sardine who leads an underwater army against predators using military tactics.

	Alireza Ghasemi, whose â€œIn the Land of Brothersâ€ won the Sundance World Cinema Dramatic Competitionâ€™s directing award in 2024, directs â€œRainy Dreams,â€ a hybrid animation-live action work tracking six displaced children in Calais as they navigate their fears and aspirations through nightly dreams.

	Chen Xudong makes his feature debut with stop-motion monster film â€œRoxanne,â€ set in a post-apocalyptic ocean and following a boy born at sea searching for humanityâ€™s last hope. The project is produced by Lu Xiaowei, whose â€œLight Pillarâ€ screens at Berlinale Perspectives this year.

	Carl Josep E. Papa, whose â€œThe Missingâ€ won best animated film at the Asia Pacific Screen Awards in 2024, directs multi-perspective drama â€œSentinel,â€ centered on a transfer student, editor-in-chief and school principal who clash when a campus newspaper article exposes violence in the schoolâ€™s military training program.

	Producer Isabelle Glachant reunites with director Lei Lei on â€œTooth and Tales,â€ a fairy tale about a boy searching for the story that can heal his toothache. Leiâ€™s â€œSilver Bird and Rainbow Fishâ€ competed in Rotterdamâ€™s Tiger Competition in 2022.

	Liongoren, whose â€œHayop Ka!â€ competed at Annecy in 2020, directs â€œZsazsa Zaturnnah,â€ about a shy gay hairdresser who swallows a space rock that transforms him into a flamboyant female superhero, compelling him to battle zombies and aliens.

	The genre slate spans psychological thrillers, body horror and action drama across diverse international settings. Zhou Jinghao, whose â€œGirl on Edgeâ€ screened in Cannes Directorsâ€™ Fortnight in 2025, directs suspense drama â€œIn the Name of Rightâ€ about a maintenance worker whose decision to help a struggling employee triggers a fatal accident. Leste Chen produces.

	Tayfun Pirselimoglu, whose â€œKerrâ€ served as Turkeyâ€™s Academy Awards submission in 2023, helms crime thriller â€œThe Power Plant,â€ following a dangerous liaison between a married meatball vendor and an excavator operator amid mutilated murders in a snow-covered mining town.

	Park Kiyong, director of â€œGangwondoâ€ in 2021, helms action drama â€œSearchers: Blood in the Grass,â€ tracking a Korean apple farmer who teams with his reluctant Mongolian father-in-law to rescue his pregnant wife from a powerful political dynasty involved in international fentanyl trafficking.
	

	Lam Li Shuen, co-director of â€œBorn of the Yam,â€ which screens in Berlinale Forum Expanded this year, directs mythological body horror â€œStrange Rootâ€ (Keinginan), set in 11th-century Singapore and featuring a demi-god born from a yam who is driven toward violent and erotic confrontation after being cast aside.

	Gabriel Motta makes his feature debut with supernatural horror â€œThe Veil,â€ exploring violence within faith and family through a religious cult founded on fake possession rituals that descends into darkness when a vengeful entity genuinely possesses the pastorâ€™s daughter. Mottaâ€™s short film â€œThe Veilâ€ screened at Toronto in 2025.

	Qinâ€™s debut â€œWhat My Bones Knowâ€ is set in a freezing, dying mining town and entangles a college graduate, a terminally ill miner and a runaway accountant, all drawn to a local tavern following the discovery of a severed ear.

	All work-in-progress projects will pitch March 17 at the Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centreâ€™s Starlight Theatre, with teams presenting 10-minute first looks to industry attendees including distributors, producers, investors, festival programmers and funding representatives.

schema.headline: Brian Tse, Alireza Ghasemi, Tayfun Pirselimoglu Projects Among Hong Kong HAFâ€™s Final Slate

title: Bodybuilder Jayne Trcka, Miss Mann in 'Scary Movie,' Cause Of Death Released
description:
'Scary Movie' Star Jayne Trcka
                          Cause of Death Released
body:
'Scary Movie' Star Jayne Trcka
                          Cause of Death Released
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              February 11, 2026
                            1:00 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Bodybuilder Jayne Trcka -- who played Miss Mann in "Scary Movie" -- died from heart and circulation issues ... TMZ has learned.
      
    
          The San Diego County Medical Examiner listed Jayne's immediate cause of death as hypertensive and atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease complicated by left femoral fracture.
      
    
          The M.E. says chronic alcohol use was a contributing factor in her death ... and they say her death was an accident.
      

                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          The report backs up what we first told you ... that Jayne was found unresponsive in the kitchen in her San Diego home back in December. Jayne wasn't answering a friend's phone calls for days and the friend went to the home and found her unresponsive before calling 911. First responders arrived and pronounced Jayne dead.
      
    
          Jayne competed in bodybuilding shows in the '80s before she landed her first acting gig in 2000 with "Scary Movie." The role led to spots on "The Drew Carey Show" and "Whose Line is it Anyway?" ... and she also reportedly worked as a California realtor.
      
    
      
        
                    
                      MAY 2011
                  
      
                    TMZ.com
          
    
          JT also appeared in several fitness magazines ... including Flex, MuscleMag International, and Women's Physique World.
      
    
          She was 62.
      
    
          RIP

title: Person Of Interest Detained for Questioning in Nancy Guthrie Abduction Case
description:
Nancy Guthrie
                          Person of Interest Detained for Questioning
body:
Nancy Guthrie
                          Person of Interest Detained for Questioning
                          ... Not A Family Member
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              February 10, 2026
                            6:30 PM PST
                                                                      |
                                                                Updated 
                                  February 10, 2026
                                7:27 PM PST
                                    
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          TMZ has confirmed a person of interest has been detained by Pima County Sheriff's Department in the abduction of Savannah Guthrie's mom, Nancy.
      
    
          A law enforcement source involved in the investigation tells us it is not a member of the Guthrie family.
      
    
          The Pima County Sheriff's Office tells TMZ the individual was detained during a traffic stop south of Tucson.
      
    
          We broke the story ... our law enforcement sources told us the operating theory is the kidnapper is from the Tucson area and wrote the ransom note that was sent to a couple Tucson TV stations and TMZ.
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    TMZ.com
          
    
          This morning, the FBI released the first images of Nancy's apparent kidnapper ... and the feds blasted the footage out to the public on the same day they received the info.
      

                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          As we told you, the abductor is promising to return Nancy to Tucson within 12 hours of receiving the $6 million ransom ... which means they're currently somewhere within a roughly 700-mile radius of Tucson.
      
    
          There were 2 ransom deadlines, both of which have passed ... even though Savannah tried reaching out to the kidnapper and even offered to pay up.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Tuesday afternoon we noticed activity for the first time in the Bitcoin account listed in the first ransom note that was sent.
      
    
          Story developing ...

schema.headline: Person Of Interest Detained for Questioning in Nancy Guthrie Abduction Case

title: Sophie Rain Stuns in Tiny Bikinis During Mexico Beach Trip
description:
Sophie Rain
                          Beachside Babe Poses After Revealing $100 Million Earnings
body:
Sophie Rain
                          Beachside Babe Poses After Revealing $100 Million Earnings
                      
                  
                                                                        Published 
                              
                February 10, 2026
                
                            2:33 PM PST
                                                                      |
                                                                Updated 
                                  February 10, 2026
                                3:09 PM PST
                                    
      
    
          Sophie Rain's enjoying some well-deserved R&R after making bank on OnlyFans last year ... soaking up the sun in a tiny bikini on a Mexican beach.
      
    
          The influencer lounged around the beach in the Cancun area over the weekend ... wearing a couple cheeky 2-piece bikinis which left little to the imagination.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Rain's thong-style, multicolored numbers clung to her curves while she pulled back her silky brown locks and even went down to the sand for a few glam shots.
      

          Photos are Sophie's stock-in-trade, as you know ... so, even though she's chilling on the beach with some of her pals, she never turns down some great lighting if she can help it.
      
    
          Rain's been posting from south of the border frequently over the last couple days ... earlier today, Rain shared a pic in a tight blue dress and danced on a balcony -- captioning the clip "cancun ğŸ‡²ğŸ‡½."
      
    
      
        
              
    
    
          Of course, Rain's got more than enough cash to cover the bill on this trip for herself and her friends ... as you know, she recently claimed her fans on OF have made it rain to the tune of $100 million for her.
      
    
          One glance at this photo shoot, and it's not hard to see why!

title: 'TMZ After Dark' Gets a 'Vanderpump' Makeover From Venus & Natalie
description:
'TMZ After Dark'
                          Vanderpump Rules the Tour ...
body:
'TMZ After Dark'
                          Vanderpump Rules the Tour ...
                          As Venus & Natalie Lead Raunchy Ride!!!
                      
      
    
      
        
                    
                  
      
                    TMZ.com
          
    
          The new cast of "Vanderpump Rules" completely took over "TMZ After Dark," led by breakout stars Venus and Natalie, who made passengers feel like they were on an actual episode of the show!
      
    
          The duo took us back to the early, raunchy days of 'Vanderpump.' And with DJ Nyla DJing the bus, the energy was high from the start as Venus and Natalie jumped right in -- dancing, hyping up the crowd, and setting the vibe for the night.
      
    
          The first stop was the Rainbow Bar & Grill, where party girl Natalie was already familiar with the manager and staff, and the pair handed out the bar's signature â€œWoohooâ€ shots, cheers-ing to the wild night ahead.
      
    
          The night continued at Saddle Ranch, where the manager welcomed the group with unlimited chicken (original and buffalo) and famous pink gummy shots, followed by Venus riding the mechanical bull and nearly making it through the full ride before being thrown off in an epic fall.
      

          The grand finale was SUR, Lisa Vanderpumpâ€™s iconic restaurant, where manager Guillermo greeted the bus and led everyone inside. Venus and Natalie went behind the bar to serve passengers their Big Pinky shots, and with the entire Season 12 cast in attendance -- including Chris and Marcus -- guests met every breakout star.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Venus and Natalie partied hard with the bus all night, dancing, celebrating, and making out multiple times, keeping the energy wild until the very end.
      
    
          What are you waiting for ... grab your tickets to the hottest party in town!!!
